main event: A bright white light was observed traveling from southwest to northeast over Lemoore, California in December 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as looking like a star, about the size of a pea, and emitting a bright white light.
The object was observed for approximately 5-15 minutes, deviating from its initial course and appearing to start and stop.
The observers reported no sound associated with the object.
Weather conditions were clear with scattered clouds, and no unusual meteorological or astronomical conditions were reported.
The sighting was initially reported as an unidentified flying object, but was later determined to be a probable satellite (ECHO I).
